title: Configure Live Support with CTI
content:
If Service Management is integrated with your CTI system, you can configure it so that when your agents receive a telephone call, Service Management automatically displays information about the caller and details about the caller's requests in the Live Support page. You can also configure it to display a specific request.

To integrate Service Management with your CTI system, you must ensure the CTI system provides the appropriate URL so that Service Management can display the appropriate information.

URL format

The format for the URL is:

https://<Service Management server>/saw/cti?field1Name=<field 1 name>&field1Value=<field 1 value>

You can include up to three fields in the URL. For example, with two fields the URL format is:

https://<Service Management server>/saw/cti?field1Name=<field 1 name>&field1Value=<field 1 value>&field2Name=<field 2 name>&field2Value=<field 2 value>

Field Description
<field name>

The name of the field. You may use any of the following:

  • Any searchable field taken from the person record. The format is user.<field>. For example, user.FirstName and user.LastName.

  • The phone number taken from the person record. The field name is OfficePhoneNumber.

    If the URL includes OfficePhoneNumber, Service Management tries to match the number of the incoming phone call with the office phone numbers held in the person records.

  • The request record ID number. The format is request.Id.
<field value>

The value of the field in the record.

Special characters in the field value must be URI-encoded so that Service Management can display the appropriate information. 

Example URLs

The following examples assume the suite server is at https://sma.itSMAX.io.

  • To send a request ID with a value of 10234: 
    https://sma.itSMAX.io/saw/cti?TENANTID=xxxxx&field1Name=request.Id&field1Value=10234
  • To send a user name of John Smith: 
    https://sma.itSMAX.io/saw/cti?TENANTID=xxxxx&field1Name=user.FirstName&field1Value=John&field2Name=user.LastName&field2Value=Smith
  • To send details of a user whose office phone number is 792-3599999: 
    https://sma.itSMAX.io/saw/cti?TENANTID=xxxxx&field1Name=user.OfficePhoneNumber&field1Value=792-3599999
  • To send a phone number with a ‘+’ sign (+1-295-555-2030): 
    https://sma.itSMAX.io/saw/cti?TENANTID=xxxxx&field1Name=user.OfficePhoneNumber&field1Value=%2B1-295-555-2030

Related topics

  • How to deal with a Live Support call
